required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of Cuminum Cyminum Herbal =Preparation in Inhibition of Plaque and Gingivitis.
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Cuminum Cyminum Herbal Preparation in Inhibition of Plaque and Gingivitis

lead_sponsor.agency: Maharishi Markendeswar University (Deemed to be University)

clinical_study.source: Maharishi Markendeswar University (Deemed to be University)

brief_summary.textblock: Present work was to investigate the possible efficacy of 0.2% cuminum cyminum herbal preparation as an antiplaque and antigingivitis agent when compared with chlorhexidine.

detailed_description.textblock: To evaluate and compare the efficacy of 0.2% cuminum cyminum herbal preparation against 0.2% chlorhexidine by various clinical parameters i.e. plaque index, gingival index and sulcus bleeding index.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Group phase A Group phase B Group phase C
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: PLAQUE INDEX: Turesky-Gilmore-Glickman Modification of Quigley Hein 1962
Gingival Index: Loe H ans Silness 1963
Bleeding on probing: Muhlemann HR and Son 1971

arm_group.description: cuminum cyminum mouthwash in chronic gingivitis patients
herbal mouthwash in chronic gingivitis patients

intervention.description: Cuminum Cyminum mouthwash in chronic gingivitis patients
herbal mouthwash in chronic gingivitis patients
intervention.other_name: herbal mouthwash in chronic gingivitis patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- volunteers with minimum 20 natural teeth without restoration.
- cooperative
- motivated and committed to participate in the trial period.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Antibiotic or anti-inflammatory therapy in previous month.
- Any known allergy/ hypersensitivity to any product used in trial.

facility.name: Department of Periodontology, M.M. College of Dental Sciences and Research.

reference.citation: Southern EN, McCombs GB, Tolle SL, Marinak K. The comparative effects of 0.12% chlorhexidine and herbal oral rinse on dental plaque-induced gingivitis. J Dent Hyg. 2006 Winter;80(1):12. Epub 2006 Jan 1.

Salgado AD, Maia JL, Pereira SL, de Lemos TL, Mota OM. Antiplaque and antigingivitis effects of a gel containing Punica granatum Linn extract: a double-blind clinical study in humans. J Appl Oral Sci. 2006 Jun;14(3):162-6.

Bettaieb I, Bourgou S, Wannes WA, Hamrouni I, Limam F, Marzouk B. Essential oils, phenolics, and antioxidant activities of different parts of cumin (Cuminum cyminum L.). J Agric Food Chem. 2010 Oct 13;58(19):10410-8. doi: 10.1021/jf102248j.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Maharishi Markendeswar University (Deemed to be University)
